page.title: 02Foxearth - 1
page.content: In 1086 the name was{Focsearde}. Many variants like Foxherne and Fox- holle occur in documents over the next few hundred years. Perhaps it is nice and romantic to imagine the foxes' burrowing places alongside the boars' lea (Borley); but we think it was really{Folksworth}and our forebears were from across the North Sea. Today, the population is 60% aliens who have come (but not from Outer Space) in the last twenty years. Among those who have lived here more than a quarter century we only found six who were born and bred in the village. Similarly, young people nearly always have to move away to find work and houses they can afford. In 1966 (when Mr. Finch became Headmaster) the church Youth Club had thirty members; now only four still live in the village - two married couples.
